title: S&P Dow Jones Indices To Launch Its Own Cryptocurrency Index Amid Bitcoin Resurgence
text: The S&P Down Jones Indices, a unit of market data provider S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), is collaborating with Lukka Inc to introduce a global cryptocurrency index sometime next year. Lukka is a New York-headquartered software company centered around blockchain technology and the digital assets domain.

title: Nasdaq apologises for Australia stock exchange outage
text: Exchange operator Nasdaq Inc on Friday apologised for an Australian stock exchange outage last month, which wiped out nearly a full session of trading.

title: Market Recap: Thursday December 3rd
text: The three major indices rose after data showed new weekly jobless claims fell more than expected last week, even as businesses contended with myriad new stay-in-place measures as COVID-19 cases spiked. Jay Jacobs - SVP, Head of Research & Strategy at Global X ETFs and Kevin Nicholson - RiverFront Investment Group Global Fixed Income Co-CIO, joined Yahoo Finance's Jared Blikre, Seana Smith, and Adam Shapiro to break down today's market action on Yahoo Finance Live.

title: Dollar weakening expected to last into 2021 as risky bets remain
text: The dollar's weakening is likely to last at least another six months as investors continue to shift to risky assets and higher returns, a Reuters poll of currency strategists found.

title: JPMorgan says emerging markets are 'under owned,' stocks could rally as much as 20%
text: With the exception of China and India, many emerging markets elsewhere have been mostly shunned by investors in 2020.

title: This under-the-radar policy risk could set off a tantrum in rates at the next Fed meeting
text: Richard Bernstein Advisors' Michael Contopoulos believes there's a chance the Federal Reserve may sound less dovish at the next meeting.

title: U.S. Labels 4 More Chinese Companies as Military-Controlled
text: Dec.03 -- The Pentagon added four more Chinese companies to a list of firms it says are owned or controlled by China's military, exposing them to increased scrutiny and potential sanctions by the U.S. Tom Mackenzie reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: Cramer highlights technology outfits that make digitization possible
text: With or without the pandemic, technology has always produced fabulous long-term winners, the "Mad Money" host said.

title: A 'Great Reset' Is Coming... But Not For Capitalism
text: The World Economic Forum sees the coronavirus pandemic as an opportunity to completely reset capitalism.

title: Markets Expected to End Year Down 10-12%: Allianz's Mahajan
text: Dec.03 -- Mona Mahajan, Allianz Global Investors U.S. Investment Strategist, talks about her outlook for markets on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Markets Split as S&P 500 Falls From Record High Amid Rising COVID-19 Cases
text: U.S. equity markets split today as the S&P 500 retreated from a new all-time high on news that Pfizer will only be able to ship half of the vaccine doses it previously planned to distribute.

title: Stock futures flat ahead of November jobs report
text: The rate of job gains have likely slowed in November due to the spike in new coronavirus cases that have led to fresh lockdown restrictions.

title: Unemployment Claims Drop, but Holiday Week May Be a Factor
text: The decline was the first in three weeks, despite a resurgence of Covid-19 cases. Economists warn of more job losses ahead.

title: A Trump Fed Pick Squeaks Through Senate Confirmation
text: Christopher Waller will be the fifth Trump pick on the Fed's seven-member Board of Governors.

title: The Market Is Waiting For The Jobs Report (Technically Speaking For 12/3)
text: The latest Beige Book contains mixed analysis.

title: Today's consumer has $1 trillion more in spending power driven by savings: Fmr. Macy's CEO
text: Terry Lundgren, Former Macy's chairman and CEO, says it's not new there are shipping delays during the holiday season. Retailers plan for what they expect for this time period and make sure packages are delivered in time.

title: The Dow Rose Only 86 Points Because Pfizer Cut Its Vaccine Outlook
text: Pfizer announced cuts to the number of Covid-19 vaccine doses to be distributed this year. Many stocks held their ground because the odds of a fiscal stimulus bill passing soon are increasing, and economic data were upbeat.

title: Market Extra: Why a weak dollar and a strong stock market are likely to keep going hand in hand
text: The stock market saw its best November since 1928, while the dollar suffered a historic drubbing of its own, strengthening a relationship that some market watchers expect to remain in place for some time.

title: Small-Cap Stocks Set for a Strong December
text: Considering the holiday season and the potential for three vaccines by yearend, Wall Street is betting on a Santa Claus rally and for the markets to continue to climb higher this The post Small-Cap Stocks Set for a Strong December appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: Stock Market Today: Investors Buy Stimulus Hopes, But Not With Both Hands
text: If Thursday's modest gains are any indication, investors are growing more optimistic about the chances of some sort of COVID stimulus package before the end of the year, but they're not counting their chickens, either. Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Thursday that there was "movement in the right direction" and that a bipartisan rescue package is "within reach"; that said, Democrats and Republicans are still at odds about several key aspects.

title: Highland Capital Partners launches SPAC to target disruptive commerce, digital media, software
text: Bob Davis, partner at Highland Capital Partners, joins 'Closing Bell' to address some concerns people have on SPACs and to discuss why it's getting into the SPAC market now.

title: One of the big themes for next year is international stocks: BNY Mellon's Young
text: Liz Young, BNY director of market strategy, says investors should look at the European consumer for overseas equities starting in the second quarter of 2021. She adds emerging markets in Asia would also be a beneficiary of that trend.

title: Pelosi and McConnell spoke today on Covid aid, government funding bill
text: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority leader Mitch McConnell are in talks to advance the Covid stimulus and government funding bill.

title: Nasdaq closes at record high as Congress inches toward stimulus deal
text: US equities closed mixed as investors cheered encouraging jobless claims data and progress toward a stimulus-package compromise. The Nasdaq composite closed at a record high, while the S&P 500 lost its record close in the final hour of trading amid concerns a vaccine rollout will be slower than expected.

title: Three Reasons to Believe in Wall Street's Santa Claus Rally
text: Recent history shows that the S&P 500 is more likely to finish in positive territory between Christmas and the first two days of the new year than at other times. Will Santa bring gifts for investors as we head into 2021?

title: The Decline Of The Dollar
text: The value of the U. S. dollar has declined substantially since the presidential election as it has fallen 4.3 percent against the Euro and 3.5 percent in an dollar index.

title: Indexes Fade Late On Pfizer News
text: Zscaler and Snowflake were big earnings movers, while EXP World Holdings continues to base nicely. title: Goldman Sachs' Jonny Fine on inflation expectations hitting an 18-month high
text: Inflation expectations have just hit an 18-month high, spilling over into the bond market. Jonny Fine, Goldman Sachs head of investment grade syndicate, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss what this could mean for the U.S. equity and bond markets.

title: Dow loses altitude. S&P 500 turns negative in last hour of trade as Pfizer said to slash rollout target for COVID-19 vaccine
text: U.S. stocks lost some momentum on Thursday after said that Pfizer Inc. expects to ship half of the COVID vaccines it originally planned for this year because of supply-chain problems, but still expects to roll out more than a billion doses in 2021. The Dow Jones Industrial Average was trading up 0.3% at 29,955, but off its best levels Thursday at 30,110, pushing it below its closing record.

title: Billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones forecasts the economy will see an 'absolute supersonic boom' in 2021
text: Billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones told Yahoo finance there will be an "absolute, supersonic boom" in the economy in the second and third quarters of 2021 as the coronavirus vaccine unleashes pent-up demand across the US.   "The vaccine is going to bring us back. We're going to have an incredible growth rebound," Jones said.

title: Here's What Happens to Stocks if No Stimulus Bill Gets Done This Year
text: Stock traders with a short time horizon should keep watching whether there will be a relief package soon, not how large it will be.

title: SPACs Are Top of Mind for Everyone, Says Capitol Investment CEO
text: Dec.03 -- Mark Ein, Capitol Investment Corp. chairman and chief executive officer, talks about the benefits of SPACs on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: SpaceWaves: ‘Out of this world' commodities opportunities abound in space (with video)
text: Trillions of dollars worth of commodities exist in the vastness of space just waiting for someone with the technical know-how, technology and logistics capabilities to extract them from asteroids and get them back to Earth.  “It's out of this world, literally,” remarked Tom James, a commodities and finance expert who edited “Deep Space Commodities: Exploration, Production and Trading.

title: Stock market seeing coronavirus relief, vaccine, divided government: Former NYSE CEO
text: The market is factoring in "a divided government" and "a president that is going to have to work with both sides of the aisle," former NYSE CEO Dick Grasso said.

title: The Profits Driving Stock Market Narratives and Hyperbole
text: “Spencer bought NIO a few days ago, and he is already up 35%” The quote above is a friend's text describing his 15-year-old's investing prowess. When asked if Spencer realizes NIO Company (NIO) is worth about twice the Ford Motor Company (F), the reply was the equivalent of a blank stare.

title: Why Neil Hennessy's 2021 playbook is about pent-up demand
text: Neil Hennessy, Hennessy Funds chief investment officer, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss his 2021 market outlook and the names he's watching.

title: Congress clears bill that could delist US listed Chinese companies
text: Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita and Zack Guzman discuss Congress clearing a bill that could de list US listed Chinese companies. Also, Senator Van Hollen discusses the bill in an interview that was previously recorded on December 2, 2020.

title: Economic Preview: U.S. jobs report in November could show economy at a crossroads
text: Did a record coronavirus outbreak trigger the first drop in U.S. employment in November since the onset of the pandemic last spring? Some economists think so.

title: ECB Has Run Out of Tools on U.S. Dollar, Deutsche Bank's Saravelos Says
text: Dec.03 -- George Saravelos, global head of FX research at Deutsche Bank, explains what the European Central Bank can do to combat a weaker U.S. dollar. He speaks with Bloomberg's Tom Keene on “Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: Kynikos' Chanos Says Shorts Are Easy to Find, But Aren't Working in This Market
text: Dec.03 -- Kynikos Founder & President Jim Chanos says while investors are interested in shorts, they feel they have very little to no downside risk because of the Fed put, creating a dangerous environment. He speaks exclusively with Scarlet Fu on “Bloomberg Front Row.

title: Kynikos' Chanos Calls 2020 Stock Market the `Golden Age of Fraud'
text: Dec.03 -- Famed short-seller Jim Chanos says the fraud cycle usually follows the financial cycle with a lag. He explains that the longer the bull market goes on, the more people believe things that are too good to be true.

title: People will spend more money despite the fact we're in a pandemic: Aureus's Firestone
text: Kari Firestone, chairman, CEO and co-founder of Aureus Asset Management says November saw a gain of 11.27 percent for the S&P 500 benchmark. That is the best gain for the S&P 500 since April, helped by vaccine efficacy news and resolution to U.S. electoral uncertainty.

title: Narrative the top five stocks are driving the market is gone: Josh Brown
text: Ritholtz Wealth Management CEO Josh Brown says FAANG stocks aren't doing anything as other sectors that were laggards during the pandemic are now rising. He joins 'Fast Money Halftime Report' to discuss the latest market action with MarketRebellion.com co-founder Jon Najarian.

title: Investors Far Too Negative on U.S. Dollar: HSBC's Mackel
text: Dec.03 -- Paul Mackel, Head of global FX research at HSBC, discusses his outlook for the U.S. dollar in 2021 and the euro. He speaks on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Middle East.

title: The Economic Recovery Is Weakening. The Good News: Companies Still Want to Invest.
text: Companies are demonstrating more confidence in hiring and spending for 2021. That's a good sign for investors.
